history.content:
Prof Adhkiari stated this in Data 001 Piazza post, "Here's what I see from the instructor's side. Students should add their own experience.

 

The Fall 2019 class is filling up faster than previous 140 classes. For much of today (Friday 4/26) there have been about five spaces available.

 

I expect that there will be some movement on the enrolled list from now until the start of the Fall term. The waiting list will be expanded from 5 students per section to 10 students per section. There are no plans to expand class size.

 

My guess is that students who got on the waiting list early have a pretty good chance of getting in. I don't have a reliable prediction for others.

 

In the past couple of terms, a few students per section dropped the class in the second or third week of the semester, after the pace and demands of the class (and of their other classes) began to sink in.

 

When the Fall term starts, waitlisted students who are serious about staying in the class should turn in all the assignments in case spots open up and they get in."

children.subject:
personally, I doubt if the waitlist will clear much above 30.  If you look at the enrollment drop history of this class, usually < 10% drop.

However, on the bright side, the class in the past have been a bit smaller though in numbers, this is probably the biggest one she's had. VLSB 2050 also holds around 425, so *maybe* the class expands.

history.content:
Anyone have an idea of how likely it is I get into the class if I'm on the waitlist at position 73?

How large is the class and in prev sems how many spots open up?
history.subject: Waitlist for Stat 140 at ~position 70
